description.raw:
The `subt_gazebo` package on the gazebo9 branch has a test of the scoring system:

* #!/osrf/subt/src/gazebo9/subt_gazebo/test/score.cc

This ports that test to the `subt_ign` package, though I haven't figured out how to bring up the simulated world as part of the test. I've managed to make it work by bringing up the `virtual_stix` environment manually and then manually running the test using the following commands:

~~~
ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign \
  robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 \
  robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
~~~

~~~
# after world has loaded, start scoring:
rosservice call /subt/start "data: true"
# then manually run the test built in colcon workspace at path WS_PATH
${WS_PATH}/build/subt_ign/devel/lib/subt_ign/test_score
~~~
